content:
GenerateResource Class

Definition

Implements the GenerateResource task. Use the GenerateResource element in your project file to create and execute this task. For usage and parameter information, see GenerateResource Task.

In this Article

[Microsoft.Build.Framework.RequiredRuntime("v2.0")]
public sealed class GenerateResource : Microsoft.Build.Tasks.TaskExtension
Inheritance
Object
Task
Microsoft.Build.Tasks.TaskExtension
GenerateResource

Inherited Members

Log
BuildEngine
BuildEngine2
BuildEngine3
BuildEngine4
HelpKeywordPrefix
HostObject
TaskResources
Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Constructors

GenerateResource()

Initializes a new instance of the GenerateResource class.

public GenerateResource ();

Properties

AdditionalInputs

Gets or sets the additional inputs for the dependency checking that the GenerateResource task performs.

public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] AdditionalInputs { get; set; }
Value
ITaskItem[]

The additional inputs for the dependency checking that the GenerateResource task performs.

Remarks

For example, the project and targets files should be inputs to ensure that if they are updated all resources are regenerated.

EnvironmentVariables

Gets or sets an array of name-value pairs of environment variables that should be passed to the spawned resgen.exe, in addition to (or selectively overriding) the regular environment block.

public string[] EnvironmentVariables { get; set; }
Value
String[]

Returns an array of name-value pairs of environment variables.

Remarks

These aren't currently used when resgen is run in-process.

ExcludedInputPaths

Gets or sets an array of items that specify paths from which tracked inputs will be ignored during Up to date checking.

public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] ExcludedInputPaths { get; set; }
Value
ITaskItem[]

Returns an array of items that specify paths from which tracked inputs will be ignored during Up to date checking.

ExecuteAsTool

Property to allow multitargeting of ResolveComReferences: If true, tlbimp.exe and aximp.exe from the appropriate target framework will be run out-of-proc to generate the necessary wrapper assemblies.

public bool ExecuteAsTool { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

To be added.

ExtractResWFiles

Gets or sets a flag specifying whether this rule is generating .resources files or extracting .ResW files from assemblies.

public bool ExtractResWFiles { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

Returns the flag.

Remarks

Requires additional input filtering.

FilesWritten

Gets or sets the names of all files written to disk including the cache file, if present.

public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] FilesWritten { get; }
Value
ITaskItem[]

The names of all files written to disk.

MinimalRebuildFromTracking

Gets or sets a switch that specifies whether tracked incremental build will be used. If true, incremental build is turned on; otherwise, a rebuild will be forced.

public bool MinimalRebuildFromTracking { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

Returns a switch that specifies whether tracked incremental build will be used. If true, incremental build is turned on; otherwise, a rebuild will be forced.

NeverLockTypeAssemblies

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether to create a new AppDomain to evaluate the resources (.resx) files (true) or to create a new AppDomain only when the resources files reference a user's assembly (false).

public bool NeverLockTypeAssemblies { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the GenerateResource task should create a new AppDomain to evaluate the resources (.resx) files; false if the GenerateResource task should create a new AppDomain only when the resources (.resx) files reference a user's assembly.

Remarks

The default value is false.

OutputDirectory

Gets or sets a value specifying where to extract .ResW files.

public string OutputDirectory { get; set; }
Value
String

Returns the value.

Remarks

Could be the intermediate directory.

OutputResources

Gets or sets the name of the generated files, such as .resources files.

public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] OutputResources { get; set; }
Value
ITaskItem[]

The name of the generated files, such as .resources files.

Remarks

If you do not specify a name, the name of the matching input file is used and the .resources file that is created is placed in the directory that contains the input file.

PublicClass

Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the GenerateResource task should create a strongly typed resource class as a public class.

public bool PublicClass { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the GenerateResource task should create a strongly typed resource class as a public class; otherwise, false.

References

Gets or sets the references to load types in .resx files from.

public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] References { get; set; }
Value
ITaskItem[]

The references to load types in .resx files from.

Remarks

Resx file data elements may have a .NET type. When the .resx file is read, this must be resolved. Typically, it is resolved successfully by using standard type loading rules. If you provide assemblies in References, they take precedence.

This parameter is not required for strongly typed resources.

SdkToolsPath

Even though the generate resource task will do the processing in process, a logging message is still generated. This logging message will include the path to the windows SDK. Since the targets now will pass in the Windows SDK path we should use this for logging.

public string SdkToolsPath { get; set; }
Value
String

To be added.

Sources

Gets or sets the items to convert.

public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] Sources { get; set; }
Value
ITaskItem[]

The items to convert.

Remarks

Items passed to this parameter must have one of the following file extensions:

  • .txt: Specifies the extension for a text file to convert. Text files can only contain string resources.

  • .resx: Specifies the extension for an XML-based resource file to convert.

  • .restext: Specifies the same format as .txt. This different extension is useful if you want to clearly distinguish source files that contain resources from other source files in your build process.

    .resources: Specifies the extension for a resource file to convert.

StateFile

Gets or sets the path to an optional cache file that is used to speed up dependency checking of links in .resx input files.

public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem StateFile { get; set; }
Value
ITaskItem

The path to an optional cache file that is used to speed up dependency checking of links in .resx input files.

StronglyTypedClassName

Gets or sets the class name for the strongly typed resource class.

public string StronglyTypedClassName { get; set; }
Value
String

The class name for the strongly typed resource class.

Remarks

If this property is not specified, the base name of the resource file is used.

StronglyTypedFileName

Gets or sets the filename for the source file.

public string StronglyTypedFileName { get; set; }
Value
String

The filename for the source file.

Remarks

If this property is not specified, the name of the class is used as the base filename, with the extension dependent on the language. For example: MyClass.cs.

StronglyTypedLanguage

Gets or sets the language to use when generating the class source for the strongly typed resource.

public string StronglyTypedLanguage { get; set; }
Value
String

The language to use when generating the class source for the strongly typed resource.

Remarks

This property must match exactly one of the languages used by the CodeDomProvider. For example: VB or C#.

By passing a value to this parameter, you instruct the task to generate strongly typed resources.

StronglyTypedManifestPrefix

Gets or sets the resource namespace or manifest prefix to use in the generated class source for the strongly typed resource.

public string StronglyTypedManifestPrefix { get; set; }
Value
String

The resource namespace or manifest prefix to use in the generated class source for the strongly typed resource.

StronglyTypedNamespace

Gets or sets the namespace to use for the generated class source for the strongly typed resource.

public string StronglyTypedNamespace { get; set; }
Value
String

The namespace to use for the generated class source for the strongly typed resource.

Remarks

If this property is not specified, any strongly typed resources are in the global namespace.

TLogReadFiles

Gets an array of items that represent the read tracking logs.

public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] TLogReadFiles { get; }
Value
ITaskItem[]

Returns an array of items that represent the read tracking logs.

TLogWriteFiles

Gets an array of items that represent the write tracking logs.

public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] TLogWriteFiles { get; }
Value
ITaskItem[]

Returns an array of items that represent the write tracking logs.

ToolArchitecture

Microsoft.Build.Utilities.ExecutableType of ResGen.exe. Used to determine whether or not Tracker.exe needs to be used to spawn ResGen.exe. If empty, uses a heuristic to determine a default architecture.

public string ToolArchitecture { get; set; }
Value
String

Returns String.

TrackerFrameworkPath

Path to the appropriate .NET Framework location that contains FileTracker.dll. If set, the user takes responsibility for making sure that the bitness of the FileTracker.dll that they pass matches the bitness of the ResGen.exe that they intend to use. If not set, the task decides the appropriate location based on the current .NET Framework version.

public string TrackerFrameworkPath { get; set; }
Value
String

Returns String.

TrackerLogDirectory

Gets or sets the intermediate directory into which the tracking logs from running this task will be placed.

public string TrackerLogDirectory { get; set; }
Value
String

Returns the intermediate directory into which the tracking logs from running this task will be placed.

TrackerSdkPath

Path to the appropriate Windows SDK location that contains Tracker.exe. If set, the user takes responsibility for making sure that the bitness of the Tracker.exe that they pass matches the bitness of the ResGen.exe that they intend to use. If not set, the task decides the appropriate location based on the current Windows SDK.

public string TrackerSdkPath { get; set; }
Value
String

Returns String.

TrackFileAccess

Gets or sets a switch that specifies whether we should be tracking file access patterns.

public bool TrackFileAccess { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

True if we should be tracking file access patterns; false otherwise.

Remarks

To support incremental build, it is necessary to track file access patterns.

UseSourcePath

Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the input file's directory is to be used for resolving relative file paths.

public bool UseSourcePath { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the input file's directory is to be used for resolving relative file paths; otherwise, false.

Methods

Execute()

Executes the GenerateResource task.

public override bool Execute ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the GenerateResource task execution succeeded; otherwise, false.
